benchmark_details.name: CRAB: Cross-environment Agent Benchmark for Multimodal Language Model Agents
benchmark_details.overview: CRAB is the first cross-environment agent benchmark framework, incorporating a graph-based fine-grained evaluation method and an efficient task generation method, designed to evaluate advanced Multimodal Language Models (MLMs) across various interactive environments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive framework for evaluating multimodal language model agents in cross-environment tasks.

data.source: CRAB Benchmark-v0 dataset comprising 120 tasks across Android and Ubuntu environments.
data.annotation: Automated task generation and evaluation methodologies.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on task completions and actions performed during the evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher completion ratios and efficiencies indicate better agent performance across tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o achieved a completion ratio of 38.01% in the evaluation.
methodology.validation: Tasks were verified by field experts for accuracy and relevance.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset will be open-sourced under Apache 2.0 License.
